description: Erection of a side elevation dormer window to main existing roof; rear roof extension with two side elevations dormer roof windows; enlarged extract flue
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision. 
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.
Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: Unspecified block plan, unspecified site plan, unspecified fire statement. Received: 06/12/2024
AC/AG/23/10001(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10002(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10003(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10004(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10005(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10006(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10007(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10008(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10009(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10010(rev.A), AC/AG/23/10011(rev.A), received 18/04/2024.
AC/AG/23/10030. Received: 19/04/2024
AC/AG/24/20015. Received: 23/04/2024
AC/AG/23/10013(rev.B), AC/AG/23/10019(rev.B), AC/AG/23/10017(rev.B), AC/AG/23/10018(rev.B), AC/AG/23/10031, Received: 28/05/2024
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 4 - New, extended and relocated extract ducts (smell, steam, fumes etc). Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the installation, air-flow calculations, operation and maintenance of the extract ducting, ventilation system inlets and outlets. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently maintained and retained. 
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell/odour from.
Condition : 5 - External noise from machinery, extract/ventilation ducting, etc. 
Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the external sound level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment and mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external sound level emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. A post installation noise assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the sound criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from plant/mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies CC2 and EQ5 of the Local Plan.
